changesets.comments: misc: added keywords to .desktop entry, fixes #896

journals.notes:
The freedesktop standard about "desktop entries":http://standards.freedesktop.org/desktop-entry-spec/desktop-entry-spec-latest.html states that "values are not meant for display, and should not be redundant with the values of Name or GenericName."

Current GenericName entry actually covers all of your proposed keywords...

Spyhawk wrote:
> The freedesktop standard about "desktop entries":http://standards.freedesktop.org/desktop-entry-spec/desktop-entry-spec-latest.html states that "values are not meant for display, and should not be redundant with the values of Name or GenericName."
> 
> Current GenericName entry actually covers all of your proposed keywords...

Your GenericName value should be changed to e.g. "first-person shooter". At the moment the value is more suitable for a comment. The keywords would all make sense if the GenericName would be changed accordingly. Like I said feel free to use more or different words which would help to promote the game on the user's desktop.
True, it's way too long for this field. Thx for (all) the report(s).

subject: Adding keywords to desktop file
description:
The current desktop file for ET: Legacy does not contain any keywords. Those are useful in modern desktop environments where they will be taken into account when performing search requests, e.g. via Gnome Shell. Feel free to update or change the list of keywords as you see fit.

My proposed patch is attached to this bug report.
